oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Rugby Toll Bridge
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Gate house and a toll bridge. There is a man with a horse-drawn buggy paying a toll at the bridge, which crosses over White Oak Creek.

As part of the historic Rugby Community, a toll bridge was built on this site in 1880. When the toll ended, the state built a Howe through truss here, and in 1920, the Howe was replaced by a Warren pony truss which still stands. The Warren truss is considered a contributing element to early motor transportation into and out of the Rugby area.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Looking Back at Tennessee Photograph Collection, 1890-1981
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Carriages & coaches; Toll bridges; Bridges; Tolls; Horses; Gatehouses
